Description.val: This line item funds modifications to the E-6 Mercury aircraft to improve mission capability and readiness.  All sixteen (16) aircraft in the E-6 fleet will receive each modification.  The E-6 is a manned airborne communications platform designed to provide a survivable, endurable, and reliable airborne Command and Control Communications capability in support of the President, Secretary of Defense and United States strategic and non-strategic forces. Safety Deficiencies (OSIP 008-02) corrects high risk aircraft safety hazards to protect personnel and equipment enabling mission readiness.  Tech Insertion (OSIP 003-04) corrects aircraft obsolescence, supportability, weight management and interoperability deficiencies through new technology insertion enabling mission readiness and mandate compliance. Service Life Extension Program (OSIP 003-07) extends the service life of the aircraft to 2040+ through airframe strengthening and structural data recording and analysis.  Communications Upgrade (OSIP 012-07) installs expanded aircraft communication bandwidth capability required to improve airborne command post operations.  Block I (OSIP 008-10) corrects Airborne Command Post (ABNCP) operational test deficiencies to improve mission capability, readiness and legacy system obsolescence.  Multi-Role Tactical Common Data Link (OSIP 013-10) installs expanded aircraft communication bandwidth capability required to interoperate with United States Strategic Command's National Command and Control Architecture.  Auxiliary Power Unit (APU) (OSIP 002-12) corrects airborne command post operational test deficiencies by installing an improved APU to meet increased aircraft power requirements.  Family of Advanced Beyond-Line-of-Sight Terminals/Presidential and National Voice Conferencing (FAB-T/PNVC) (OSIP 014-14) replaces obsolete Military Strategic Tactical Relay terminals with improved FAB-T, and installs PNVC to provide specialized secure voice capability over the strategic Advanced Extremely High Frequency satellite communications system.

Justification.val: The FY 2016 funding request was reduced by $9.635 million to account for the availability of prior year execution balances.

Name.@footnote: Other Support cost in FY17-FY20 is for continued support of emergent aircraft safety hazards to enable mission readiness.

ImplementationMethodName.val: Drive In:: Installation Name: KAPTON 1A Kit
Drive In:: Installation Name: FQIS Kit
Drive In:: Installation Name: Blankets Phase 2 Equipment
Drive In:: Installation Name: Training Equipment

Description.val:
DESCRIPTION/JUSTIFICATION:  Safety Deficiencies corrects high risk aircraft safety hazards to protect personnel and equipment enabling mission readiness.  Federal agency directives, aging aircraft material condition, and the operational environment generate safety hazards for correction.  Modifications include, but not limited to: Fuel Quantity Indicating System (FQIS) installation; Aircraft Acoustic Thermal Blankets replacement; Kapton wiring replacement; and other safety deficiencies that require correction. 

DEVELOPMENT STATUS/MAJOR DEVELOPMENT MILESTONES: FQIS Non-Recurring Engineering (NRE) completed in FY10 with production kit buys and installations in FY11-FY17; Acoustic Thermal Blanket Phase 2, 1 install kit complete in FY12; 4 kit buys and installations in FY13-FY14 (5 A/C); Aircraft Kapton Wire kit buys and installs in FY13 to FY20.

Name.@footnote: Data cost in FY16 is for the data publications of HPTS Camera efforts; in FY17, for CNS/ATM data publications; and in FY18, for HF ALE data management.
Training Equipment cost in FY15 is for the HPTS Camera.
ILS cost in FY16 is for Seats ILS management.

Installation Kits N/R in FY15 and FY16 is to support the CNS/ATM & HF ALE procurement in FY17.  Installation Kits N/R in FY17-FY20 is to support HPTS, CVLR, MOM, AC Electrical, and ALCS NRE A Kit procurement in FY19.
Administrative and Production Leadtimes vary for training equipment in FY13, FY15, and FY17-FY19.

ImplementationMethodName.val: Drive In:: Installation Name: ARC 210 Radio/Crypto
Drive In:: Installation Name: CARBON BRAKES
Drive In:: Installation Name: HPTS Camera

Description.val:
DESCRIPTION/JUSTIFICATION:  Tech Insertion corrects aircraft obsolescence, supportability, weight management and interoperability deficiencies through new technology insertion enabling mission readiness and mandate compliance.  Unsupportable computing technology, communication systems, interoperability gaps, and the need to maintain aircraft range and endurance through weight reduction generates mission critical modification requirements.  Modifications include, but not limited to: CRYPTO Modernization; Brakes; Seats; Glare Shield; High Power Transmit Set (HPTS) and the HPTS Camera; Automated Dependent Surveillance Broadcast (ADS-B OUT); High Frequency Automatic Link Establishment (HF ALE); Common Very Low Frequency Receiver (CVLR); Communication Navigation and Surveillance Air Traffic Management (CNS/ATM); Missions Operation Monitor (MOM); Aircraft Electrical System; Airborne Launch Control System (ALCS); and other tech insertion corrections.

DEVELOPMENT STATUS/MAJOR DEVELOPMENT MILESTONES:  CRYPTO Modernization Non-Recurring Engineering (NRE) FY11-FY12; production kit buys in FY12-FY13 with installs in FY13-FY14. Brakes NRE kit installed in FY13; production install kit buys in FY12-FY14 with installs in FY13-FY15.  Seats NRE in FY13; with NRE kit buy and installation in FY14; production install kit buys in FY14-FY15 and installation in FY15 and FY16.  Glare Shield NRE kit buys in FY14 with production kit buys and installation in FY14-FY16.  HPTS NRE FY17,and NRE Kit Buy in FY18; production kit buys FY19 to Beyond FYDP.  HPTS Camera NRE FY14; NRE kit buy in FY15; production kit buys in FY15-FY16 and installs in FY16-FY17.  ADS-B Out NRE kit buy FY16; production kit buys and installation FY17-FY18.  HF ALE system NRE kit buy FY17; with production kit buys and installs FY18-FY20.  CVLR NRE FY17 and NRE kit Buy FY18; production kit buys and production installs FY19 to beyond the FYDP.  CNS/ATM NRE Kit buy FY18; production kit buys and installs FY19 to beyond FYDP.  MOM NRE Kit buy FY19; production kit buys and installs beyond FYDP. Aircraft Electrical NRE kit buy FY20; production kit buys and installs beyond FYDP.  ALCS NRE kit buy FY19; production kit buys and installs FY20 to beyond FYDP.

Name.@footnote: IATS Software upgrades are required for aicraft to reach 45,000 flight hours.  Must have completed SLEP and have a current tracking sytem.
Other Support cost in FY17 is to support the Installation N/R CSFIRS Phase 2 contract award in FY17.  Other Support cost in FY19 is to support the production phase of the CSFIRS Phase 2 effort.
Installation Kits N/R cost in FY18 and FY19 is to support the start of the CSFIR Phase 2 effort.

ImplementationMethodName.val: Drive In:: Installation Name: SLEP Phase One Kits
Drive In:: Installation Name: CSFIR Phase Two Kit
Drive In:: Installation Name: Training Equipment

Description.val:
DESCRIPTION/JUSTIFICATION:  Service Life Extension Program (SLEP) extends the service life of the aircraft to 2040+ through airframe strengthening and structural data recording and analysis.  Just in time modifications to prevent aircraft grounding due to fatigue life expended.  Modifications include, but not limited to: SLEP; Individual Aircraft Tracking System (IATS); Crash Survivable Flight Incident Recorder (CSFIR) Phase 2.

DEVELOPMENT STATUS/MAJOR DEVELOPMENT MILESTONES:  SLEP Installation Kit production buys in FY09-FY16 with installs in FY09-FY16.   CSFIR Phase 2 Non-Recurring Engineering (NRE) FY17 to beyond Future Years Defense Plan (FYDP) with NRE kit buy in FY19; NRE kit install, production kits and production installs beyond FYDP.

Name.@footnote: Phase One A Kit unit cost in FY14-FY17 is based on negotiated contract pricing.
Phase Three A Kit unit cost in FY14-FY17 is based on negotiated contract pricing.
Phase One Equipment unit cost in FY14-FY17 is based on negotiated contract pricing.
Phase Three Equipment unit cost in FY14-FY17 is based on negotiated contract pricing.

ImplementationMethodName.val: Contractor Drive In:: Installation Name: Phase One & Three
Drive In:: Installation Name: Training Equipment

Description.val:
DESCRIPTION/JUSTIFICATION:  Communications Upgrade installs expanded aircraft communication bandwidth capability required to improve Airborne Command Post (ABNCP) operations.  Internet Protocol (IP) connectivity and wideband communication capability to enable voice, video and data services is mission critical to command and control operations.  Modifications include: IP Phase 1, International Marine/Maritime Satellite (INMARSAT); IP Phase 3, removal of Utility Trailing Wire Antenna (UTWA). 

DEVELOPMENT STATUS/MAJOR DEVELOPMENT MILESTONES:  IP Phase 1 INMARSAT NRE FY07-FY09 with NRE kit installation in FY09.  Phase 1 production kit buys in FY10-FY17 with installs FY11-FY18.  IP Phase 3 UTWA removal NRE FY07-FY08 with NRE kit install in FY09.  Phase 3 aircraft production kit buys in FY10-FY17 with installs in FY11-FY18.  IP Phases 1 and 3 installations will be completed concurrently with the Block I production program in FY12 through FY18.

Name.@footnote: Data cost in FY17-FY18 is based on negotiated contract pricing.
ILS support cost in FY15-FY17 is based on negotiated contract pricing.
Block I A Kit unit cost in FY14 and FY17 is based on negotiated contract pricing.
Block I Equipment unit cost in FY15-FY17 is based on negotiated contract pricing.
VTT B Kit unit cost in FY14-FY17 is based on negotiated contract pricing.

Description.val:
DESCRIPTION/JUSTIFICATION:  Block I corrects Airborne Command Post (ABNCP) operational test deficiencies to improve mission capability, readiness and legacy system obsolescence.  Modifications include, but not limited to: Block I; Very Low Frequency (VLF) Transmit Terminal (VTT); Technology Upgrade. 

DEVELOPMENT STATUS/MAJOR DEVELOPMENT MILESTONES:  Block I Systems Integration Lab (SIL) & aircraft (A/C) development kit installed in SIL FY06 and in A/C FY08; Milestone-C 3Q FY10; Low-Rate Initial Production (LRIP) contract award 3Q FY10; LRIP 1 kit buy in FY10 and 3 kit buys in FY11 with installs in FY11 and FY12 (4 A/C); Full-Rate Production (FRP) Decision Review achieved 2Q FY12.  FRP kit buys FY12-FY17 (11 A/C) with installs in FY13-FY18.  VTT Prototype SIL and A/C development kit delivery in FY11 with installation in FY12.  SIL and A/C testing 2Q FY12 to 1Q FY13.  VTT Production kit buys in FY13-FY17 with installs in FY13-FY18 (15 A/C).  Technology Upgrade NRE in FY15 with NRE kit buy in FY15 and installation in FY15; production kit buys in FY15-FY18 with installs in FY15-FY18.

Name.@footnote: Data cost in FY15 is for Data management of MR-TCDL effort to support a installation contract award in FY16.
ILS cost in FY14 and FY15 is to support the ILS systems integration of the MR-TCDL program.
Other Support cost in FY19 is required to manage the remaining installs.

DEVELOPMENT STATUS/MAJOR DEVELOPMENT MILESTONES:  MR-TCDL contract award FY12; Non-Recurring Engineering (NRE) in FY12-FY13 with NRE aircraft kit buy in FY13, NRE kit installation in FY14 and test in FY15.    Production kit buys in FY15-FY18, with installs FY16-FY19.

Description.val:
DESCRIPTION/JUSTIFICATION:  Auxiliary Power Unit (APU) corrects Airborne Command Post (ABNCP) Follow-On Operational Test (FOT&E) deficiencies by installing an improved APU to meet increased aircraft power requirements.  Modifications includes, but not limited to: APU.

DEVELOPMENT STATUS/MAJOR DEVELOPMENT MILESTONES:  Development FY09-FY13.  Prototype aircraft development kit delivered FY11 with installation in FY13.  APU production kit buys FY14-FY18 with installs in FY16-FY19 (15 A/C).

Name.@footnote: Other Support cost in FY16 is to support non-recurring, production and installation.  FY18 support includes specialized enterprise-wide flight follow-on test and evaluation support.  FY20 support is to support remaining installs.

Title.val: Family of Adv Beyond-LI-of-Sight Term/Pres&Nat'l Voice Conf (FAB-T/PNVC)(OSIP 014-14)

ImplementationMethodName.val: Drive-In Modification:: Installation Name: Lab - PNVC
Drive-In Modification:: Installation Name: Training Equipment

Description.val:
DESCRIPTION/JUSTIFICATION:  Family of Advanced Beyond-Line-of-Sight Terminals/Presidential and National Voice Conferencing (FAB-T/PNVC) replaces obsolete Military Strategic Tactical Relay terminals with improved FAB-T, and installs PNVC (includes Red Switch) to provide specialized secure voice capability over the strategic Advanced Extremely High Frequency satellite communications (SATCOM) system.  This modification includes, but not limited to: FAB-T; PNVC . 

DEVELOPMENT STATUS/MAJOR DEVELOPMENT MILESTONES:    FAB-T lab kit buy in FY15 and install in FY16; PNVC lab kit buy and install in FY16. Non-Recurring Engineering (NRE) in FY15-FY16 with NRE kit buy in FY16 and NRE kit installation in FY17; production kit buys in FY17-FY19, with installs in FY18-FY20.
